fields.title: Everything Everywhere All At Once
fields.review: So far the best execution for a Multiverse theme. An emotional rollercoaster, with top notch humor and scenes that will make you cry multiple times.

fields.title: Pride and Prejudice
fields.review: Beautiful execution of a Jane Austen Classic, with superb acting from the casts.

fields.title: Chungking Express
fields.review: Chungking Express is a 1994 Hong Kong romantic crime comedy-drama film written and directed by Wong Kar-wai. The film consists of two stories told in sequence, each about a lovesick Hong Kong policeman mulling over his relationship with a woman.

fields.title: Arrival
fields.review: Intense and emotional, with a plot that will keep your head guessing.

fields.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
fields.review: A memorable coming-of-age movie that holds a special place in my heart.

fields.title: Love, Rosie
fields.review: Will take you to a journey of being in a 'Right-Person-Wrong-Time' slowburn. Heartwrenching, tearjerking.

fields.title: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
fields.review: Walter Mitty embarks on an adventure of a lifetime, and the feel of thrill and freedom can be felt through the screen.

fields.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
fields.review: After discovering a monolith on the lunar surface, the Discovery One and its revolutionary supercomputer set out to unravel its mysterious origin.

fields.title: Back to the Future
fields.review: Marty travels back in time using an eccentric scientist's time machine. However, he must make his high-school-aged parents fall in love in order to return to the present.

fields.title: Isle of Dogs
fields.review: A Wes Anderson stop-motion has never gone wrong.
